item.title: The shape of yields to come
item.description: Central banks are likely to buy up short-term bonds to keep debt costs down for governments

item.title: The sad decline of investment clubs – and what comes next
item.description: Financial regulation and rising costs are killing off investment clubs that once used to be an enjoyable hobby, says David Prosser

item.title: Why pension transfers are so tricky
item.description: Investors could lose out when they do a pension transfer, as the process is fraught with risk and requires advice, says David Prosser

item.title: The political economy of Clarkson’s Farm
item.description: Clarkson’s Farm is an amusing TV show that proves to be an insightful portrayal of political and economic life, says Stuart Watkins

item.title: How to profit from the UK leisure sector in 2026
item.description: The UK leisure sector had a straitened few years but now have cash in the bank and are ready to splurge. The sector is best placed to profit
